meanings.definition: People who work, especially manual laborers.
meanings.sent1: The workfolk in the factory were busy assembling the products.
meanings.sent2: The workfolk at the construction site were lifting heavy materials.
meanings.sent3: The workfolk decided to have a race to see who could finish their tasks first.
meanings.sent4: The workfolk were the gears that kept the machinery of the company running smoothly.
meanings.sent5: The workfolk's dedication to their craft was truly admirable.

meanings.definition: The collective group of workers at a particular job or workplace.
meanings.sent1: The workfolk gathered in the break room for their lunch break.
meanings.sent2: The workfolk collaborated on the project to ensure its success.
meanings.sent3: The workfolk organized a surprise party for their boss.
meanings.sent4: The workfolk were the heartbeat of the company, pulsing with productivity.
meanings.sent5: The workfolk's unity made the workplace a harmonious environment.
